TopicDetails.title: Automated Number Plate Recognition Systems (ANPRS)

types.typeOfAction: HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant

3253942.action: HERCULE-TA-2017-01 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant
HERCULE-TA-2017-03 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant
HERCULE-TA-2017-02 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant
HERCULE-TA-2017-04 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

The purchase, maintenance and interconnection of systems for the recognition of vehicle number plates (Automated Number Plate Recognition Systems – ANPRS) or container codes for purposes related to the protection of the financial interests of the Union, provided these systems do not overlap with existing EU funded systems, such as the European Car and Driving Licence Information system (EUCARIS network, See: https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/community/eucaris/description),

or the European Register of Road Transport Undertakings (ERRU, See for example: http://ec.europa.eu/transport/modes/road/access/erru_en.htm) and the: Réseau Permis de Conduire (RESPER, See for example:

http://ec.europa.eu/idabc/en/document/3989/5926.html).
TopicDetails.conditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

1.   List of countries and applicable rules for funding: Described in section 2.2 of the Call Document: Technical Assistance 


2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: Described in section 6.2 of the Call Document Technical Assistance 


3.   Evaluation

      3.1. Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: Described in section 6 of the Call Document Technical Assistance 

      3.2. For submission and evaluation process, see the Call Document Technical Assistance

4.   Proposal page limits and layout: Please see the proposal template part B


5.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: described in section 8 of the Call Document Technical Assistance 


6.   Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:

      Standard proposal template
      Guide for applicants
      Model Grant Agreement – Mono-Beneficiary


7.   Additional documents:
       Annual work programme 2017
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
For further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals, please contact: OLAF-FMB-HERCULE@ec.europa.eu


Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.


IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.


H2020 Online Manual – Please use the manual with caution and only for the Participant Portal tools guidance, i.e. Submission service and Beneficiary register, because it is H2020 specific and does not cover the Justice Programme rules. Some aspects of the Justice Programme are different from the provisions of the H2020 programme.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action and topic, as these cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

latestInfos.content: A draft version of the template for the Monobeneficiary Grant Agreement has been published under section 7: additional documents ("click: download files").
A new overview with Frequently Asked Questions and Answers is published on 3 August 2017.
The submission session is now available for: HERCULE-TA-2017-04(HERCULE-ER-AG), HERCULE-TA-2017-03(HERCULE-ER-AG), HERCULE-TA-2017-02(HERCULE-ER-AG), HERCULE-TA-2017-01(HERCULE-ER-AG)
